website_summaries.verdict: The Kindle Voyage is Amazon's best e-reader to date, and probably the best e-reader ever -- but it doesn't come cheap.
pros: The Kindle Voyage is the summit of Amazon's e-reader line: it's the company's lightest touchscreen model ever, with the best resolution and contrast to date, better built-in lighting, a flush glass front and dedicated page-turn buttons
cons: It's not a huge upgrade over the Kindle Paperwhite, but it costs considerably more
And you'll pay more still for a case, which isn't included

customer_reviews.title: I switch hands holding the Kindle when I read and I thought it would be nice to be able to turn the page when I ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get the Voyage when I lost the Paperwhite. The only reason I shelled out the extra $80 for the Voyage is because of the page press. I switch hands holding the Kindle when I read and I thought it would be nice to be able to turn the page when I hold it with my left (I know, first world problem). However, I was sorely disappointed. Sometimes the response lagged greatly, other times it would jump two pages with one press. I ended up just using touchscreen to save myself the trouble of relocating. Personally I also feel the loading is not as fast and smooth as the Paperwhite. Maybe I just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L.

customer_reviews.title: "Refurbished" version had many things wrong with it. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.text: The one star is for the "Certified Refurbished" part. Lots of stuff wrong with it out of the box: Touch didn't work on the lower-left corner of the screen. It drained a full battery in about an hour. Didn't connect reliably to the 3g network. Clearly, it was sent back to Amazon as faulty and nobody bothered to actually refurbish (or even check it) before sending it out again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Holub

customer_reviews.title: Quit working less than one month after warranty
customer_reviews.text: I loved this device and use it all the time. Without warning or event, it suddenly stopped working literally two weeks and one year after I bought it. I paid $240 for the basic model without advertising. Do you think I'm a happy Kindle customer? Do you think I feel good about a device that works just long enough to get out of warranty? For one year of use, $240 is pretty steep. And if you think Amazon will work with you on something like this because you've been a dependable Prime customer for years and do most of your purchasing through their service, well you can let go of that silliness right now.
customer_reviews.author: Evox Ideo

customer_reviews.title: Will brick when out of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: It was fine while it worked but don't expect it to last too long. While fully charged, mine locked me out with a non-changing, slightly corrupted screen saver that blinks every 14 seconds (see 1st image). I tried to restart it (power button 7 seconds) and to force a hard start (power button 40 seconds) to no avail. Removed it from Fintie case and confirmed that the magnets weren't turning the screen off. Plugged it into PC and charge light stays orange (see 2nd image). Not recognized by PC as any connected USB device. It is now a small expensive paper weight/drinks coaster.
customer_reviews.author: Craig F Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Love my voyage, but...
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Kindles. But one thing that Amazon could do to make organizing our books easier is when we move books into a collection, store them under that collection name, just like a file. I don't want to see every single book I have every time I open it. I'd rather click on collection and then see the books that are in that collection. AMAZON, this should be easy to fix!
customer_reviews.author: Marion Westerling

customer_reviews.title: I received my Kindle Voyage yesterday and am in love!! For a book blogger who is constantly ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my Kindle Voyage yesterday and am in love!! For a book blogger who is constantly reading books, this is the best device. I used to complain about my Kindle Paperwhite because the page turn was so slow and when I wanted to change to a diff page to check information it was frustrating. Not with my new toy! It's fast, the page turn bezel is wonderful, and the image so sharp. I love that it's thinner and lighter and much more comfortable to hold, especially for long hours. This is the best Kindle I've had so far. For all readers who spend a lot of time reading like I do, I really recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa Rivas-Martinez

customer_reviews.title: discontinued?
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Voyage in July to replace my earlier one which I dropped on a tile floor. Glad I got it when I did because Amazon seems to have discontinued it. Just don't like the asymmetrical look of the Oasis or its metallic feel. Love the page turn buttons on Voyage and just the general feel of it. For me its just about a perfect e-reader. Disappointed they are not selling them anymore
customer_reviews.author: farthestnorth

customer_reviews.title: Voyage E-readers' big advantage over Paperwhite E-readers:  the PagePress (page turner) function
customer_reviews.text: I've had both a Kindle Paperwhite and a Kindle Voyage E-reader in the past. Lost the first and broke the second (my fault). Without hesitation I ordered another Kindle Voyage E-reader again to replace the broken one. It's worth the extra price for one major reason: if you're in a cold place and wearing gloves—e.g., waiting for a friend at a corner in winter—you can turn the pages on the Voyage E-reader without taking off a glove! If you have a Paperwhite, you have to take a glove off to swipe or hit the screen. Otherwise, the two seem equally wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Battery Life says it all. The Voyage display is very good, better than the Paperwhite, however the Voyage battery life is terrible. I own a Paperwhite, and the battery life on it lasts for days if not weeks, depending upon how much reading I am doing. I purchased the Voyage for my wife as the display was crisper than my Paperwhite, however, the battery life is awful. After a couple of days of low use, the battery is just drained. I have the wifi turned off, so it is not that, I can not understand why the battery life is so bad. Looking back I wish I had purchased her the Paperwhite.
customer_reviews.author: edcpro

customer_reviews.title: Self-destructed for no reason, $270 down the drain
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my Kind Voyage just stopped working for no reason after a year and a half -- possibly because of the recent kindle software update? Now the device won't even start up. I spoke with customer service and they say I need to buy a new one because the warranty expired. Seems like if you create a product that self-destructs from a software update after a year and a half, you should offer more than 25% off a new one. Almost criminal. I enjoyed my Kindle until this happened... But I don't see how I can rationalize buying a new device if it might just meltdown for no reason after 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Peaslee

customer_reviews.title: ... been using a Paperwhite for 5 years and absolutely loved it, until I lost it on vacation
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using a Paperwhite for 5 years and absolutely loved it, until I lost it on vacation. Since I needed to get a new one, I decided to upgrade to the Voyage, which I ended up returning for a Paperwhite. The page turn function was too sensitive for me, even with setting change. I found it hard to hold because it's really small and has no rim to hold onto without turning pages. I gave it a try and just didn't feel right to me. So grateful Amazon gave me a full refund, and now I have my beloved Paperwhite again.
customer_reviews.author: lphon

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the size, weight, and clarity of my Kindle Voyage. Hate the advertisement screen saver. Liked my Paperwhite screen saver with the pencils, pens, and other writing implements. When asking the sales person about how to get rid of the unwanted advertisements, he said I should have bought the most expensive Kindle - I did - with no special offers! That surprised him. Went on line and found this has been an ongoing complaint. Seems the sales person should have known, and Kindle should have fixed it by now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: READ AND ENJOY IT
customer_reviews.text: THE FONTS ARE GREAT UNTIL THEY GO CRAZY AND RESIZE THEMSELVES DOWN TO THE LOWEST SIZE. WITH WORK i CAN READ THEM . I HAVE LEARNED IF THEY KEEP CHANGING AND I DON'T HAVE CONTROL, THE BATTERY IS LOW SO I PLUG IT IN AND IMMEDIATELY GAIN CONTROL AGAIN. I LOVE TO READ BUT POCKET BOOKS ARE HARD FOR ME TO SEE AND COST MUCH MORE THAN I CAN AFFORD EACH MONTH. WITH MY KINDLE AND AMAZON PRIME I CAN READ A BOOK A DAY WITHOUT MUCH MONEY. EVEN THO I AM 82 YEARS OLD I WILL NEVER OUTGROW READING. WITH KINDLE I AM NEVER WITHOUT READING MATERIAL.
customer_reviews.author: beajai

customer_reviews.title: Amazing e-reader
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE (May 2019): I’ve now had this Voyage for 4 years, 6 months and it still works perfectly. I use it almost daily and still travel with it all the time. Love it so much that I haven’t even considered any kind of upgrade. Still holds a charge just like when I first received it. I’ve had my Voyage since November 2014 (3 years). Under very heavy usage this works just the same now as the first day I got it. I’ve traveled everywhere with this and I’ve never had any issues. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love my kindle
customer_reviews.text: Such a wonderful little device. It makes reading a pleasure and I love that I don't get eye strain. I can't ever read on my iPad because it hurts my eyes too much, and regular books can cause strain if I'm not under the best lighting. Never have this problem with this kindle. I like that it's compact and light as well. I can take it everywhere without a problem. My only regret is that I didn't buy a kindle years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: It's great but still struggling to find much of a difference from the Paperwhite.
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say I really like the Kindle Voyage it's great. I really liked all of the kendalls. But I especially like the Paperwhite. I saw the Voyage on sale and thought I'll try the upgrade. I like the idea of having a Kindle at home and one on the road. So no complaints. But but I purchase on sale because I don't see a big difference from my Kindle Paperwhite. I'll keep playing around with it and update the review if I find improvements that I actually can see or feel. Otherwise it's a great Kindle so no complaints. I received a recertified and it came like new.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Shawn

customer_reviews.title: great updated device
customer_reviews.text: The updates from the Paperwhite all work really well: auto screen brightness means I never have to think about it. The haptic feedback from the page-turn buttons on the bezel is a great improvement too. I'm not in love with all the book ads that come up on the device, especially since I paid for "no special offers" and of course I'm going to buy the books from Amazon, sheesh, but we really do live in an era when advertising rules the world. I had trouble finding a case that didn't have animal products in it, but the Belkin Foliois animal-free, and it is a good-quality case that deserves better ratings than its current three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle Ever
customer_reviews.text: The Voyage is hands-down the best Kindle ever made. The micro-etched screen really cuts down on glare and makes the 300 ppi resolution screen even crisper. I bought an Oasis and was so disappointed by the screen. On paper the Oasis has the same resolution, but the loss of the micro-etched screen really decreases clarity. I had already gifted my old Voyage to my wife, so I just ordered this new Voyage for myself. I'm happy to report the Voyage's screen still looks great and is far superior to both the Oasis and the new Paperwhite (which I also ordered but returned).
customer_reviews.author: JavaLSU

customer_reviews.title: It's more like a triple
customer_reviews.text: The Voyager is not entirely a home run. It's more like a triple, with the baserunner half way to home. The buttons for turning pages back and forth, for example, are a bit sensitive and take some time getting used to. The self-adjusting light could also use some work. I DO have to adjust the lighting occasionally. Yet the Voyager is noticeably lighter, faster and sharper. The sharper text is enough to justify the cost to me (I sold a Paperwhite on ebay to cover half the cost). I need reading glasses for newspapers but not for the Voyager. It's even easier to read than the Paperwhite.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save the trees - read your kindle!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one as a replacement for my old 2nd generation 6" kindle. This one is somewhat pricey but i like the additional functions it has, including an option of choosing from several languages. I must say that advertisements are annoying but when you put it permanently on airplane mode - who cares? What I don't like is a non-flat back of the device and cannot really understand the need for it. Overall I am satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Chikindas

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Voyage dead at 15 months
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Kindle and I've especially enjoyed the readability of the print as my eyesight is failing, and Wi-Fi connectivity since I travel a lot and love to binge read. I use my device almost everyday. However, Kindle tech support just declared my kindle dead after only 15 months--it won't reload after restarting--with no explanation. Unfortunately, I didn't buy an extended warranty with the Voyager since my first Kindle (the original model) is over 10 years old and still working. I strongly recommend you consider an extended warranty for this model. BTW: Amazon offered me a discount of about 10 bucks from $269 to $255. Really? The online price is only $199.
customer_reviews.author: Janice D. Bordeaux

customer_reviews.title: Minimally updated paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Paperwhite until a flying dog bone cracked the screen. I debated between this one and replacing my paperwhite, but figured new is better, right? Wrong. Other than the touch bevel sides and being a bit thinner and lighter, this is a paperwhite. I spent an extra $80 for those dumb features. Out of all the Kindles, I think the paperwhite is the best. It's pure reading with no distractions. I love my paperwhite and I'm sure I'll end up liking this Voyage, but I feel stupid for paying extra for such minimal improvements. If you're debating, save your money and get a paperwhite
customer_reviews.author: KaliMau

customer_reviews.title: Page turner buttons rock
customer_reviews.text: My favorite eReader so far. I purchased the Voyage in July 2017. It's small, light and I love the page turn feature. The Paperwhite is a great product but I will always want the page turn feature. I looked at the Oasis and while it has nice features, it's bigger than the Voyage. Amazon, I hope you make updates to the Voyage and continue to offer it as an option.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My first e-reader experience, so nothing to compare to, but very happy with this one. I bought a new one and later bought a refurbished one and cannot tell the difference. I leave one on the treadmill and use one for travel. No problems with screen discoloration, battery life, or other issues expressed by others. Makes reading enjoyable again. Love the size, the variety of offerings, appreciate many print books being available in Kindle version, and no books to buy and store or give away. Very easy to hold without fatigue and ability to adjust print size is so much easier on the eyes. Would definite recommend the Voyage to anyone who wants to enjoy reading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: The kindle I always wanted...
customer_reviews.text: I've had a bunch of kindles but this one is the best of them. Best features are the page turners on the edge, the shut off button on the back and how easy it is to hold in one hand. Wanted an Oasis but can't justify the price. The only thing missing is sound like the second or third kindle had on it. Battery life isn't as good as I thought it was going to be. Love it's simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Top of the Morning

customer_reviews.title: right where I like to hold on to it
customer_reviews.text: Too slow! I press a button and wait a couple of seconds and nothing happens. The I try another button and then the first one kicks in. Also the page forward and backward tabs are right on the sides of the unit, right where I like to hold on to it. This causes more waiting and ending up where I didn't want to go. It just isn't worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Doolittle

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love this...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this ereader...especially at the reduced price (promotional price for Prime members) I ended up with 3 (1st purchase, then 2 replacements) They all had the uneven lighting issue. Screen clarity is great...but, the discoloration was too distracting. Hopefully the next gen will be better, like the PW2 was better than the PW1. Just frustrating that this is an issue with the Premier reader.
customer_reviews.author: JVansickle

customer_reviews.title: Now if I could just turn off the touchscreen while I read...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent e-reader, improving on the already excellent Kindle paperwhite. The e-ink images are even easier to read than the previous models. I really welcome the return of physical page turn buttons! The adjustable sensitivity and feedback for turning pages is bang on target. The relocated button for turning the screen image completely on or off is also an improvement. Battery life is satisfactory. Physical size is just right. I continue to wish there was a way to turn the touchscreen features completely off while reading a book; maybe I'm just clumsy, but I still find myself inadvertently changing font size or turning pages when I do not wish to.
customer_reviews.author: mmccluski

customer_reviews.title: Careful when buying refurbished by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: After some research of Voyage vs Paperwhites, decided to order the former. Only refurbished items are currently available. It took me three attempts before I received a working Voyage. The first one arrived in a brown box marked as Voyage, but inside was some other Kindle model. Returned. The second one arrived in a similar box, inside was a correct model, but it didn't charge. Apparently, many Voyages have problem with a charging port. Returned. Only the third time I have received a refurb Voyage without apparent issues. I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: A nice step up from the Paperwhite (though I had version ...
customer_reviews.text: A nice step up from the Paperwhite (though I had version one - so I'm comparing different resolutions). Refurbished item was mint. I couldn't tell it wasn't brand new. I never liked tapping the screen to navigate as you need to move your hands so I love the Voyage PagePress feature. So far the only thing I'd like to be different as others have mentioned, would be to have little bumps to identify the PagePress buttons. It's up to the individual whether the price difference between Paperwhite & Voyage is worth it though I only paid $32 more than a new Paperwhite and I'm very happy with that choice.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Kindle, hands-down.
customer_reviews.text: Love the page-turn buttons. (I do wish they were customizable as to which pages forward or back, but I guess I'm greedy) Also like the flush surface, so no chance of grit build-up over time. Easily my favorite kindle yet (upgraded from Paperwhite and basic models).
customer_reviews.author: Vince in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Don't get refurbished.
customer_reviews.text: Don't pay attention to description on mobile. It does not include a slipcase and amazon support just denies it's even on their mobile site/app at all. Purchase a new one. My refurbished models battery is junk. I have to charge it constantly and it even drains half battery on idle in less than 24 hours (in airplane mode). Pretty sad because otherwise I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic reader!
customer_reviews.text: I've traded in my Paperwhite for this one because really missed the page turn buttons from my original Kindle. Well, the buttons on this one don't work quite as nicely as I'd hoped they would, but boy, the resolution on this baby is great! Well worth the upgrade just for that. I just realized that supposedly the Voyage has the same resolution as the Paperwhite, but still, it looks so much better than that; maybe it's the number of LEDs and the adaptive brightness, I don't know, all I know that I enjoy reading a lot more since I've got the Voyage.
customer_reviews.author: LikesPenguins

customer_reviews.title: I've had the Voyage for 4 years and simply love it. It's easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Voyage for 4 years and simply love it. It's easy to hold, and the page press functionality is great on either hand. It has very nice features such as the adaptive lighting, many different fonts, and of course the ppi300 is super sharp for reading. There are many different cases for it and over the years I've collected a few. The battering charge is great. For an avid reader, the initial charge is about 2-3 weeks (if you read more than 30 minutes a day). Although it is a bit pricey, I don't see how anyone can go wrong since it'll last for years because of its' great quality. The Voyage truly enhances the reading experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars Means Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Things I like - that it has a screen as large as my 3rd gen, but can fit into a pocket; that it has a much longer battery life than my Kindle Fire; that it doesn't have the glassy surface of my Kindle Fire (or the distractions). Truthfully, I love it. I like the way it organizes my books, keeps up with my reading on other apps (phone or Fire), and isn't too bright - or too dull. In fact, the only thing that makes me a little crazy is the on/off button on the back. Why? Why not just put it on the top/bottom like my other Kindles? That said, five stars means five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Braley

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to Love It, But I DON'T
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it's small, easy to carry and the screen is pleasant to look at. I just hate the way I have to navigate from page to page. If I want to find a new purchase, instead of finding it through a "recent purchase" option, I have to go through page after page to find it. Sometimes I buy several books at once and don't want to look for each separately through the search button. I've come to prefer the kindle app on my iPad. It's SO EASY to navigate and equally pleasant to read. Wish I could get my money back from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: RMG

customer_reviews.title: Almost the perfect ebook!
customer_reviews.text: Having used the Paperwhite for a few years, and loving it, I was somewhat skeptical of the Voyage because of the 80.00 cost difference. But now that I've tried the Voyage, downloaded my thousand plus books, I must say that I am hooked. I love all the new features, plus the size and weight, but my favorite feature is the position of the power button. Just squeeze the top right hand corner with thumb and forefinger and it's done. My biggest pet peeve about the Paperwhite was the location of the power button. (Now if I had my dream ebook, it would be the Voyage, in color, with audible capabilities.) Still, I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: GaryLH

customer_reviews.title: My favorite e-reader
customer_reviews.text: I had a paper white and upgraded to this. It is faster and brighter than the paperwhite. Also like the haptic response on the page turn buttons. The design fits better and more comfortably in my hand. I paired it with the premium brown leather case and it looks and feels great! Worth the upgrade if you are considering it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gutgesell

customer_reviews.title: ... 3rd Kindle and they are getting lighter and more comfortable to hold as they progress
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Kindle and they are getting lighter and more comfortable to hold as they progress. The font and letter size is extremely adjustable and I haven't had any issues with the back lighting being off or too bright in spots as others have experienced. The only negative at this point is the page press only works sporadically and more often not at all. That said, the touch screen page turn works perfect so it really doesn't matter to me. Love the Kindle and carry it with me in purse everywhere I go!
customer_reviews.author: Beagle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Go Refurbished you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the refurbished Kindle Voyage. I went back and forth on whether to buy refurbished or go with a new one. I have to admit I'm glad I went with refurbished! I saved $50 and the Kindle looks and works like NEW! Anyone Wanting to save some money, don't second guess going with the refurbished version! You get a good quality product without any cosmetic defects or software issues! Amazon truly does back up their claim that it's certified to look and work like new!! 🤑😁
customer_reviews.author: xEuphoria2017x

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Love love lovvvve this Kindle. I have an old Kindle DX and finally upgraded. The Voyage is much better. I bought on prime day so had fifty dollars off. That's why I went ahead and purchased. What a nice surprise. Being able to use the sensors to turn pages, as well as tapping the screen, is priceless. I can't imagine not having the sensor buttons while shopping and arranging. The contrast is great. If you're on the line with this and paperwhite, I recommend this for sure. Paying a bit more for something you'll use for years is an excellent investment. The youtube vids I watched before buying don't give it justice. There's so much more to this Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingSupergirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: I have had four Kindles and a Kindle fire. The Kindle Voyager is my favorite. It is easy to use The back light makes it easy to read anywhere in any light. The resolution is great. I highly recommend this Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: Mine Bricked at 16 Months too.
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers at just past warranty this unit froze dead after being well cared for. Amazon offered a discount on a replacement but given the obvious problems with this unit they should have replaced it. Very disappointed in Amazon. We have bought tons of books and spent a lot of $$$$$ with Amazon and I expected better. What a shame since we really liked the reader until it just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This item was great, until it stopped working conveniently after the warranty ...
customer_reviews.text: This item was great, until it stopped working conveniently after the warranty expired. Amazon tried to give me $15 off the basic Kindle to get me to buy another. $25 off the Voyage. Barely 10% off after selling me a $200 product that crapped out after a year. I've bought 4 kindles over the last several years for myself and others. I'm very disappointed with my experience, and wouldn't recommend this device to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Linden

customer_reviews.title: We Love Our Kindles!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I each bought a Kindle Voyage and we couldn't be happier with our purchases. The Kindles make reading an absolute pleasure, especially for seniors like ourselves who now no longer have to squint at the small typeface of hard copy books. We love the ease and convenience the Kindles afford us. The vast array of features in the Kindles are amazing and are all geared to maximize the reader's enjoyment. The Kindles have made reading enjoyable again for us and we're motivated to read a lot more books than we would have without them. The Kindle is an outstanding product!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Kindles just don't last.
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple months past one year of use and it already will not charge. This is my 4th or maybe even 5th Kindle and they have all had mechanical problems of some sort after what I consider to be, much too short of a time. I won't be buying anymore. I will just do my reading on my iPad or buy a Nook and see if they work any better. My Kindle looks new (I always keep it on a case) but it just won't charge. I have never abused any of the Kindles and they are just subpar equipment.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: They lie!
customer_reviews.text: The Voyage Kindle is wonderful. Took me a couple days to get used to pressing the "line" to move the screen forward - but that works well now and it was one of the main reasons I bought this Kindle. But Amazon flat out LIES when it says the battery lasts for "weeks" rather than hours. It does, in fact, last for 21 hours and they make up that bit about "weeks" by assuming a person reads half an hour a day. Me? I don't know anyone like that. I have to recharge the battery every other day or it runs out. That's not a bad thing, but saying the battery lasts for 'weeks' is just foolishness.
customer_reviews.author: Mem Morman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent e-reader with a frustrating design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent e-reader! There is a design flaw that needs to be corrected however. If the Voyage you receive does not have the latest update, you cannot connect to Amazon with an existing account until the Voyage is updated---and it will not update automatically wirelessly. You need to manually update it by downloading the update from Amazon's website and the update isn't easy to find. Most other devices will automatically update out of the box or at least allow you to connect to update. This functionality needs to be incorporated into the Kindle products to eliminate some fairly frustrating minutes. That being said, the Voyage (once functioning) is excellent and I am thoroughly enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: DrNiteyNite

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but Page Buttons are Tricky
customer_reviews.text: Excellent e-reader...minor issues are: screen came with some minor scratches that were thankfully out of the way. It's refurbished, so didn't expect perfection, but nearly sent this back as a result. The push buttons are difficult to push without causing the pages to skip ahead or behind several pages. You must press the outer side of the buttons or you will end up touching the screen at the same time you press the button, triggering two or more page flips...which is very confusing when it happens. I thought I had a defective device before I figured this out,. That being said, the text is super crisp, the lighting is perfect and my old eyes are in love with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Slick

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Oasis! (2018, July review)
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to say it: the Voyage is better than the Oasis. I own and use the 2016 version of Oasis, which at that time touted as the best Kindle by Amazon, but a year later I decided to buy the Voyage instead because the price was too hard to ignore. After using it only for a couple of time, it's obvious the Voyage is a better Kindle than the Oasis. If you're a first timer and got more cash to buy for a Kindle, then my advice is buy the Voyage. The form factor of the Voyage: thin, light, and not square, makes it better than Paperwhite and Oasis altogether.
customer_reviews.author: ajs

customer_reviews.title: Love This Voyage
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this Kindle Voyage I didn't know if I would like it or not, the Kindle Keyboard has always been my favorite. I have never been a big fan of touch screens but this model has page turning switches on each side and a wake up button on the back. The backlighting adapts to the surrounding light and you can make it brighter or darker as you please. I really like this Kindle and find myself using it more and more instead of my trusty old Kindle Keyboards. The one that I bought is a refurbished model but you can't tell by looking at it or using it. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bettym

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade from Kindle Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love my Kindle. I came from a kindle keyboard that had the page buttons so I wanted to keep that. The page buttons are secure and work great. The Voyage delivers. Battery life is good. I last about a week before having to charge it. I found a good case that allows it to power up and secure it. It’s my go to for reading and easy to use the Kindle store .
customer_reviews.author: Ladydulaney

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Page turn buttons not as useful as ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Page turn buttons not as useful as I thought they would be. Good clarity on the screen. I wish the Kindle software was more compatible with Collections in Calibre. I've got a large bunch of ePub books I needed to convert and side load to the Kindle. It's the one thing that had been keeping me from buying a Kindle in the past. Having the ability to upload those books to my online account was the only thing that broke that barrier for me. I had to upload the books in groups and then assign them to collections. But that's done now so It should be easy enough going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Knack51

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother if You Already Have One that Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have had Kindles since they first came out. And I couldn't live without one. BUT this last one, sounded like it would be a real improvement, but, alas, not so much. The page move function is not better and if anything is worse. Don't see great improvement in resolution etc. So, if yours isn't broken, don't bother with this new version!
customer_reviews.author: DRGATB

customer_reviews.title: and for that purpose the kindle is excellent. Any and all other features are irrelevant to ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the job well and the only reason for not giving it five stars has nothing to do with the way the kindle works. The problem is that it is produced by tech people who think everyone has their interest in and knowledge about such things. The idea that no printed instructions come with it, and you have to use the instructions in the kindle to learn how to use it, is frustrating and time consuming to a person who is not up on or interested in tech. All I wanted was something to read books on, and for that purpose the kindle is excellent. Any and all other features are irrelevant to me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great, but plenty of room for improvements
customer_reviews.text: Kindle changed the way I read many years ago. I love to carry my books wherever I go. It is great! I bought the Kindle Voyage 6" to upgrade another Kindle that is still in great shape after many years of regular use. I am sure that Amazon and its developers could improve the e-reader. I would love a larger screen, lightweight materials and why not, some Apple like features. I don't like to read with the backlight of the reader. It is not as natural as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Sec1958

customer_reviews.title: If you read a lot, it makes a difference.
customer_reviews.text: The Voyage is significantly lighter and thinner than the paperwhite, and over time that makes a difference. If you read a lot, you'll notice, and if you read a lot then it's worth the money. Unlike some of the "most helpful" reviews I have no color problem with my unit. Recommended unless you are just a casual reader or on a very very tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: Dave from Fremont

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle yet, but...
customer_reviews.text: So far works ok. Finally, the perfect sized kindle that is small enough for one handed reading for extended periods. Seems like good battery life so far. I keep qualifying review points because of the number of poor reviews...makes me keep waiting for the other shoe to drop, but so far it’s the best, most perfect Kinda yet!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very Light
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my old Kindle, this one is very small around the edges and hard to hold with one hand. I like the light. Same problem as prior Fire something one, when loading all my books from my old kindle, it added all my already read books in with the unread books. The worse problem is the touch screen locks up and will not do anything, very frustrating. Have to turn is off and retry again or try to go back to HOME and start over. So far none of the new models I have tried is nearly as good as my old 2nd generation Kindle, it went for over 10 years without one problem until this year.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded from the Paperwhite because I liked the idea of the PagePress Sensors and Adaptive Built-in ...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Paperwhite because I liked the idea of the PagePress Sensors and Adaptive Built-in Light, but I've noticed that the battery is draining way too fast (down 1/3 in 3-4 days). I'm going to give it a few more days, but this one might be going back.
customer_reviews.author: CBTP

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life after software update
customer_reviews.text: I have had four Kindles over 8 years (passed them on to friends and family) and can't live without it. Loved my Voyage until the latest software update. Amazon royally messed up a good thing. I used to be able to get at least two weeks on a charge (I read at least 1 hr a day) and now I can't get a week on a charge. The only common denominator is the software update. My husband has the Paperwhite and hasn't gotten the update yet and doesn't have any issues. If the Paperwhite doesn't get the update, go with it without any question and avoid the Voyage.
customer_reviews.author: DL Ward

customer_reviews.title: I loved the Paperwhite but the Voyage (refurbished) is a step ...
customer_reviews.text: Had the Paperwhite and it fell on the train tracks in NYC. I loved the Paperwhite but the Voyage (refurbished) is a step above. I like the tabs on side so that you don't have to constantly reach to the tap the screen with your fingers. I like the tabs because in the winter, when you're outdoors and have your gloves on you just press firmly and it moves to the next page. With the Paperwhite I had to remove the gloves to move to the next page. The screen crisp and clear. The material of the casing feels substantial yet the Kindle was lightweight. Perfect item.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Just not worth the price, I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I should have just got the new paper white. I really just wanted the auto brightness. It doesn't work very well. Now I feel like I've a paid a lot more money for nothing. Now I love Kindles, this is my fourth or fifth? I'm accident prone. Just the price/features of this one was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Big Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Page turning buttons are NOT worth the big $$ over the Paperwhite.
customer_reviews.text: After having a Kindle Keyboard and a Kindle Paperwhite, I upgraded to the Voyage because I missed the page turning buttons on the sides. Those buttons are the only difference I see from the Paperwhite and truly are not worth the huge difference in price between the two Kindles. My Voyage frequently goes back a page or forward two pages which is frustrating. The Paperwhite is the better investment of the two.
customer_reviews.author: K. T.

customer_reviews.title: Just spend the money don’t get used or on sale.
customer_reviews.text: I got this kindle on sale it was used but when it got to me it wouldn’t let me link it to my WiFi at all also it wasn’t restarted and when I did restart the old books was still they somebody else had on the kindle.. very poor!!!👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽 I still payed for it and amazon should’ve made sure it was working. I wouldn’t even give it a star at all..
customer_reviews.author: Derricks

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I was debating between the voyage and the paperwhite. I had an old paperwhite and like it, but WOW am I glad I upgraded to the voyage! I read a lot and right from the first page it is a significant upgrade. If you are on the fence, and read a lot, definitely go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Kindle- good for people who like to read but sometimes it hard to do so
customer_reviews.text: All that you stated under this Kindle was met. I am having a good time as I am- and you have to have noticed that I love to read- an avid reader. This is the first time that I use this type of gadget that allows one to read instead of a real book- I was reluctant to try it at first, but since I have to spend more than three hours in a hospital environment which is very boring, I just take a book to read, but books are heavy at times and as I can only use one arm it it difficult to hold the book and turn pages- I decided to go with the flow.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Crisp. Clear. Light. Perfect reading device. Till the next iteration.
customer_reviews.text: After the paperwhite, I didnt think there was another kindle out there for me. If you are buying a new kindle, then go the Voyage. It is crisper, clearer, lighter, smaller. All the good things. Only downside, I didnt need the 3G and should have got the wifi version, because the 3G battery doesn't last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Chan

customer_reviews.title: I loved how light it was I was used to one ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved how light it was I was used to one with the key pad. I loved the touch screen. I wish it had something to feel at night when turning the pages that my fingers could find quickly to turn the pages something as simple as a raised dot. I might have to put something on myself. Other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Languet

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and has a long battery life. I read 30-90 minutes most days of the week and used to have a Kindle Fire, whose battery would drain in a few hours. This lasts for days before I have to charge it and has a nice light so I can see even in the dark/dim room if my kid is sleeping. The vibrate function of the page press is a little annoying but you get used to it after awhile. Since I had a Kindle Fire and Kindle Paperwhite before, I often forget about that feature and just swipe to turn the page anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas Gift Ever
customer_reviews.text: My cousin was living with us this past Christmas, and she used my account to order Christmas gifts for my family. This was one of the gifts she ordered. I had wanted a Kindle for FOREVER and, despite it being much smaller than either of us thought, the Kindle Voyage E-reader is perfect! It fits in my purse easily, it's easy to navigate, the battery lasts for forever, and the adjusting light is spot on. I absolutely love my E-reader and use it very often.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: I like the size but the rest of the reader sucks
customer_reviews.text: The OS on this reader is extremely hard to navigate the system. Down loaded several books only three show and cannot find the others. Pages turn too many at one time and it is hard to get back to where you were reading previously. I like the size but the rest of the reader sucks. I preferred my Kindle Fire much better and this is the fourth one I have owned. The only reason I quit the Fire is that the charge plug would no longer insert in to the ubs port on it so I could not charge it. The Kindle Voyage OS is junk.
customer_reviews.author: EOTEXASp

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Voyage. This is my 4th Kindle Reader and by far my most favorite. It is slim and light, the page press feature allows for very simple page turning, which makes reading in bed much easier than the Kindle Touch or Kindle Paperwhite. The design is sleek and comfortable in my hand. The automatic lighting feature is great, but can sometimes play tricks on your eyes in areas lit with a lamp with an energy efficient bulb. This is a top of the line piece of equipment and I highly recommend, especially if you read a lot of books.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Paper White.
customer_reviews.text: I generally need to restart to get uploaded documents to show on my Kindle Voyage, even though on the Amazon website the docs no longer show. I assume this is a bug that can be fixed. Battery life seems shorter than my old Kindle Paper White, despite promise made that it would be much longer. I do not like the front page that I have to go through to get to my list of docs. Maybe I can delete it. I have not tried. So that is why the poor rating.
customer_reviews.author: William Telll

customer_reviews.title: Great Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I had a Kindle paperwhite and I wanted to take advantage of the lighting and buttons on the voyager. It works great. I wish it had buttons on the side so that I didn't have to roll my thumb over to turn the page. That is a small preference of mine though. It is exactly as presented. You can't beat the Kindle for reading, and this is the best one I have had. If someone is happy with their paperwhite, I'm not sure I would recommend the upgrade. Some people have issues with the paperwhite's lighting and for them, or anyone who wants a lighter Kindle, this is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Victorynsurrender

customer_reviews.title: Happy for the auto-lighting feature that dims or brightens depending ...
customer_reviews.text: My first e-reader and I'm liking it. Happy for the auto-lighting feature that dims or brightens depending on the light around me. Also thrilled with the smallness and light-weightness of it. I'm reading longer than I did when holding a book because it rests so well on things - arm of chair, lap, etc. And with the cover I bought from Omotion, it doesn't slide around. Really like that I can borrow e-books from the library and have them loaded to the kindle - FREE! Yep, I'm liking this after years of thinking I'll never stop reading paper books.
customer_reviews.author: BeTheChangeWeSeek

customer_reviews.title: I really like this kindle
customer_reviews.text: I really like this kindle. I would have rated it higher but I miss my Gen 2 or whatever Keyboard version. I love having page turn buttons, the ones here are a little awkward to use. The keyboard ones were comfortable and easier to use. I don't like the touchscreen aspect at all. With my kids grabbing at my at times, the constantly change the font or the page on my. But I had to get a new one when my keyboard one died and this had the buttons that I wanted so I go this.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: ... 2 hrs and I think I am going to love it. My old kindle keyboard is slowly dying
customer_reviews.text: I have had my new Voyage for about 2 hrs and I think I am going to love it. My old kindle keyboard is slowly dying. I had originally tried to replace it with a Paperwhite and hated it. The Voyage is far more user friendly for folks like me, who are technologically challenged. My only negative comment so far.. why did I have to BUY a user guide Amazon. Isn't that something that should come with the item?
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi48

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Kindle ereader of the five models I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I had to purchase this refurbished from Amazon after finding Oasis too awkward and cold in my small hands. I've had it for 4 months Feb - June '19. It's balanced, lightweight, and comfortable. I've missed page turn buttons since trading my Kindle Keyboard for 1gen Paperwhite. Even though the buttons are not raised buttons as I would prefer, I remedied the button issue by placing little puffy stickers where I touch to turn. It's so nice to have buttons back. One star off for stopping production on what I believe is the best ereader Amazon has offered thus far.
customer_reviews.author: L. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother...
customer_reviews.text: Meh. The one I bought had a defective 3G radio, and would only work with WiFi. Also, cases and screen protectors for the Voyager series are getting harder to find (at least in terms of cases which don't try to be an obnoxious 'fashion statement' more than just being good protection). Amazon accepted the return, no problem, so kudos for them. I would say, however, go straight to the Oasis if you're serious about a Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: kc7gr

customer_reviews.title: Great display, super lightweight and easy to navigate for newbies
customer_reviews.text: I love this ereader, very lightweight and easy on the eyes. Screen and font quality are excellent, and easy to navigate features. My first Kindle product, only previous reader a much older Nook. It had gotten heavy and slow loading times. Very easy turning pages with pressure sensitive panels, although using landscape view requires swiping to advance pages. Micro etched screen makes glare issues non-existent at all angles. Pricy but to me it has proven worthy of its cost. Look forward to keeping this as my main reader for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Ben L. Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE my Kindle Voyage. It slips in my purse and I carry it everywhere. I'm an avid reader and can't do without my Voyage. Amazon Kindle is the way to go. Fits your hand perfectly and is lightweight. Every feature of this Voyage is great. The first one I got was in 2014 and just now bought another. If something happens to this one I will definitely purchase another. Thank you Amazon for my Kindle Voyage!!!
customer_reviews.author: lane

customer_reviews.title: Should be considered like a one year lease rather a long term purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that if you use it all the time might be worth it. It should be considered like a lease since I have learned they do not last long. Even with very light use mine quit working and it was out of warranty. IMO you would be wiser to get another tablet and deal with the higher cost one time rather than this product. Surprising since I am otherwise a fan of Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: O Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I've spent hours and hours looking for the perfect case/cover for a Voyage
customer_reviews.text: I've spent hours and hours looking for the perfect case/cover for a Voyage. Turned out the best answer is NONE. The Voyage is so featherlight, easy to control, and great for hours of bedtime reading that any cover from any company would be a detriment. I have had 4 prior version on Kindle and I think this is the perfect e-reader. Was waiting for weeks for a sale and finally got one early Dec. Don't regret the high price at all--great reader.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have returned the Kindle Voyage. The page turning was an issue along with the freezing up. I turned off the sensor on the sides and just swiped with my finger and sometimes it would not even turn the page and sometimes it would turn lots of pages and it would take me awhile to find my spot again. Sometimes the screen would just freeze and I would swipe my finger over and over to get it to go to the next page. I am going back to my Paperwhite. It was a great size and lighter though.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Don't.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third kindle, purchased 2016. I have loved them all. However, this one is no refusing to charge. I am using the kindle power supply and cable, but the charge goes on and off, mostly off. It is as if the cable no longer fits the kindle properly. Although i appears to be a physical issue, this problem began after a recent update. I have been unable to find any amazon help with this problem. The lack of customer support is the real annoyance. I'll probably try another kindle, but still. I expected better of amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It Except....
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd kindle and it has been great. But, there are exceptions which merit mention. 1. When a book has photos, maps, etc it is cumbersome to see them clearly. The magnification step is a pain and seeing the entire image is always a challenge. I would not recommend the kindle if you read a lot of books with illustrations. 2. Battery life degrades quickly after a year. Time between charging is shorter and my usage has remained steady. I read between 30-60 minutes a day. Overall, my experience has been great, but the two points above may matter to some,
customer_reviews.author: madhatter

customer_reviews.title: Worth the premium
customer_reviews.text: With the recent improvement of the Kindle Paperwhite, whether the price premium for the Voyage is worth it is perhaps a tough call. For me, the smaller size, lighter weight, more evenly illuminated screen with more brightness control and especially the pressure points for page advance make it on balance worthwhile. The combination of all these make the Voyage convenient for one-handed operation for protracted periods. Tip: to bypass the ad displayed every time you turn it on (unless you pay the premium to eliminate ads entirely), press one of the pressure points for page advance instead of swiping the screen.
customer_reviews.author: ReadsALot

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few Kindles and this is still the best one. Very comfortable to hold, lightweight, and the backlit screen is great for reading in bed, on the plane, etc. The screen is beautiful and it's very nice to read for hours at a time. Would be nice if they gave it a processor upgrade so that it was a bit more responsive, but otherwise it's just about perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James Byrum

customer_reviews.title: Adaptive light feature is awful
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I chose the Voyage over the Paperwhite was the adaptive light feature. It is supposed to get brighter or dimmer depending on the light in your surroundings. This feature does not work properly for me at all. At night when I turn my Kindle on in the pitch dark the light comes on to the very brightest setting where it was during the day. Can seconds later it is still just as bright. It seems to do a fine job of getting brighter in the next day when moving from a dark environment to enlighten environment.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Love the backlight
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure if I wanted the no Kindle Voyage or the fire. After days of thought and reading reviews I decided on the Voyage. I do like it and the backlight makes reading at night so enjoyable. The page turning took a little getting used to but now it's a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Like it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kindle. The other 2 are still working, I chose this one because I missed the page turn "button" from my first Kindle. When reading at night during the winter I like to keep my arms and hands under the blanket. Now I can turn the pages with blanket in place with either my right or left hand.
customer_reviews.author: RedCat928

customer_reviews.title: easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I have had this reader for about 18 months. For the most part it was all I expected it to be; very portable, lightweight, easy to read, long battery life. However, over the past several months I have had a problem come up on an increasing number of books. Words, sentences or paragraphs are missing when I “turn” a page, i. e. parts of the story may be lost every time I turn a page. It has forced me to stop using the device and go back to my iPad, which does not suffer from this issue. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: RGP

customer_reviews.title: My Dad Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Dad who had just been reading on his phone. He loves this because he doesn't have to "swipe" so frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Stockdale

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until the "update"
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Kindle Voyage for almost a year and have absolutely loved it... until the new "update" done by Amazon on 2/23/16. In my opinion the update is terrible. I tried to set up a collection and then I could no longer access my downloaded books or my books on the cloud. I had to re-register my Voyage to get them back. Also the home screen is not at all user friendly. Why did Amazon feel they had to "fix" something that was not broken? Please, Amazon, give back my original Voyage.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.S.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! This is my first ereader sinve getting ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! This is my first ereader sinve getting the 1st gen Kindle Fire. I laughed when taking it out of the box because it's significantly smaller, but in a good way. I do miss being able to pull up "device" and see exactly how much battery life is left. However, the battery life is so great on the Voyage that it really doesn't matter. The new Bookerly font is easy on the eyes. I love the crispness of the screen and font. And page press is awesome (although you can still swipe to turn or tap the edge of the screen). Very happy with my new Kindle!
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Deming

customer_reviews.title: Freezes daily. Frustrating touch screen.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. I broke my screen on my Paperwhite, which was my favorite eReader, so bought this as a replacement/upgrade. My 2 major beefs are: touch screen is fairly insensitive, Voyage freezes on me every day. While reading, the Voyage will completely lock up in the middle of a book. This forces me to hold the power button until it restarts. A second outcome of the freeze is that Whispersync doesn't remember where the book you were. If you've been reading for a few hours, this is a bit annoying but not a deal killer. If you're looking to upgrade, I would recommend waiting until the next version comes along.
customer_reviews.author: Qwyattguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Device, lasts 1 year
customer_reviews.text: The handling, user experience, device ease, functions, and everything about using the Voyage is wonderful. However, I purchased one a while back and it broke after 1 year of moderate usage and had to buy another one. That one I bought in March 2019; it is now April 2019 and the device will not turn on or unlock. The screen lights up, but it is kind of streaky, and no "unlock" keypad option opens. I hope Amazon replaces mine and holds on to their warranty, or finds out how to make it more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Brouillette

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, low price
customer_reviews.text: This is 3 times cheaper than the new Oasis and probably 2 times cheaper than the new Kindle, but I prefer this one, It works perfectly, has the size and illumination that I need, and so far I don't see that the upgrades of the newer kindles are worth its price. I recommend this device if you don't care too much about looks and prefer quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Gato Rebelde

customer_reviews.title: Freezes up & won't register
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't register it. You're not allowed to sync anything til you register it. How hard could that be? It didn't like any of my emails, you get to do the captcha(?) numerous times, click "create account" & if you're "lucky" you'll get a popup telling you your passwords don't match, & you check that, & they DO match. Repeat the above 3 or more times. Decide it just wasn't meant to be. Go to the wifi & delete wifi password, nope. "Try again later" tried to close the wifi popup box & it freezes up...
customer_reviews.author: Dakota
